clinical_study.brief_title: Claudication, Systematic Evaluation of Limp on Treadmill
clinical_study.official_title: Claudication et Fatigue Musculaire de l'art√©riopathe

brief_summary.textblock: Vascular claudication is a common cause of functional limitation. This painful condition is a source overall muscle deconditioning in the peripheral arterial diseased (PAD) patient leading gradually to a state accented inactivity. The characterization of the claudication as it results from a proximal or distal ischemia has never carried out. Investigators will analyze dynamic pedometer parameter throughout walking tests in PAD patients with claudication

detailed_description.textblock: Patients referred for exercise tests on treadmill for the quantification of walking ability will gave a recording of their walking parameters through an instrumented treadmill recording biomechanic parameters (surface electromyography, walking pace; force of the foot/treadmill interface, length of the step.. etc.) Analysis will be performed until walking is stopped due to usual claudication during a constant load 2MPH 10% slope treadmill procedure.

primary_outcome.measure: Root mean square (RMS) of the EMG signal
primary_outcome.time_frame: RMS over 15 sec at rest and 15 sec just before the end of the walking period
primary_outcome.description: Calculation for the difference (change) in RMS value at the end vs.beginning of the walking test

arm_group.description: Patients with grade 1 claudication Measurement of biomechanic parameters while walking on treadmill

intervention.description: recording of biomechanic parameters and surface electromyography at the thigh and calf level throughout the walking period, in PAD patients .

study_pop.textblock: Patients complaining claudication and referred for a treadmill test

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Referred for treadmill testing
- Age > 18
- Claudication
- Covered by the French Healthcare system
- Consent to participate
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unstable angina
- History of lower limb osteo articular rheumatologic disease
- Lower limb amputation
- Cardiac or respiratory failure
- Neurologic disease
